theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation, respiratory chain decline, and ROS-induced mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA oxidative damage accumulation and ATP decline in aging muscle, linking mtDNA damage to mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA rearrangements causing senescence and links respiratory function and ROS to mitochondrial genome instability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects mitochondrial dysfunction, copper homeostasis, mtDNA rearrangements, and ROS in aging of Podospora anserina.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA reorganization, ROS balance, mitochondrial-nuclear signaling, and repair pathways affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mtDNA mutations and rearrangements accumulating with age causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS production causing mtDNA mutations and mitochondrial dysfunction leading to aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS production at complexes I and III to mtDNA oxidative damage accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction increasing ROS, causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial impairment in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as primary aging drivers causing oxidative damage and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondria as ROS sources causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production causing mtDNA damage and the role of mitophagy in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Instability and ROS Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative damage accumulation causing systemic aging and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Complex I Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on complex I content modulating mitochondrial ROS production and lifespan differences across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and H2O2 Sensing Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial H2O2 as a signaling molecule modulating adaptive stress responses and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores dual role of mitochondrial ROS in damage and signaling, including hormesis and reverse electron transport.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows distinct mitochondrial dysfunction modes affecting ROS metabolism and lifespan via different mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Proteostasis and UPRmt Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial unfolded protein response (UPRmt) activation via chaperones improving healthspan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Proteostasis and UPRmt Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial stress in neurons triggering systemic signaling affecting organismal aging and healthspan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Proteostasis and UPRmt Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: LCA-induced mitochondrial lipidome and proteome remodeling triggers mitochondria-to-nucleus signaling and anti-aging transcription.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Proteostasis and UPRmt Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Lipid remodeling of mitochondrial membranes alters morphology and function, promoting longevity in yeast.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Biogenesis and Mitophagy Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: PGC1α fine-tuning balances mitochondrial biogenesis and mitophagy, critical for mitochondrial homeostasis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Handling and Muscle Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in mitochondrial calcium retention and mPTP sensitivity driving muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Handling and Muscle Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS, calcium dysregulation, and mitochondrial dysfunction to muscle atrophy and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Metabolic Rate Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects mitochondrial free radical generation, metabolic rate, and damage accumulation to aging and lifespan.
